definition[0]: if you have nothing to lose, it is worth taking a risk because you cannot make your situation any worse
example[0]: You might as well apply for the job – you’ve got nothing to lose.
example[1]: The working class has nothing to lose but its chains (=disadvantages, restrictions etc).
note[0]: have nothing to lose but your pride/reputation etc
example[2]: These youngsters know they have too much to lose by protesting against the system.
note[1]: have a lot/too much to lose
